questions.question_text: A network technician needs to ensure outside users are unable to telnet into any of the servers at the datacenter. Which of the following ports should be blocked when checking firewall configuration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
- A. 22: SSH
- C. 80: HTTP
- D. 3389: RDP
- E. 8080: Alternative HTTP, often used as proxy port

Selected Answer: B
Telnet uses UDP port 23.

Port 22 is associated with the Secure Shell (SSH) protocol. SSH is a secure network protocol used for remote access and secure data communication. It provides encrypted and authenticated access to network devices and servers.
Port 23:

Port 23 is associated with the Telnet protocol. Telnet is an older, unencrypted protocol used for remote terminal access and management of network devices and servers. It is less secure than SSH.

Port 80 is the default port for the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP). It is used for unencrypted web traffic and is the standard port for web servers to serve web pages to clients.

Port 3389 is associated with the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). RDP is a proprietary protocol developed by Microsoft and is used for remote desktop and graphical user interface access to Windows-based computers.

Port 8080 is often used as an alternative HTTP port. It is commonly used for running web services or proxy servers that require a separate HTTP port, typically to avoid conflicts with the standard HTTP port (Port 80).

Selected Answer: B
ok B , AND SSH ???? I CAN TEL FROM THERE BY THA WAYYYYYY
Telnet uses TCP not UDP. And yes it's port 23.

questions.question_text: A technician just validated a theory that resolved a network outage. The technician then verified that all users could access resources. Which of the following is the next step the technician should take in the network troubleshooting methodology?

choices.D: Identify where the network outage is occurring.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C even if the answer is worded terribly. Step 7 (documenting): Documenting isn't about lessons learned, documenting is to document what you actually did to resolve the issue in case something happens again, especially if the problem comes back quickly. Lessons learned is something you do after the fact, saying there was a break in procedure that caused the outage.

Selected Answer: A
This one is kind of confusing to me. Because step 6 in troubleshooting says to verify FULL system functionality - my gut is to say A because knowing the users can access resources doesnt tell us the services are fully functional and restored. After that the next step is lessons learned/document findings/etc.. I hate these questions

comments.content:
The question is already incorrect from the get go. Says they "validated the theory..." aka step 3 which "...resolved the network outage" step 5... 

But to clarify why A isn't the answer. Yes the comptia steps say full functional and restored but based on what the problem was, a network outage. Verifying the functionality is back is what is needed and that was done by the users being able to access the service resources again.

Correct answer is C granted they worded it in the weirdest and most incorrect way. Documenting isn't about lessons learned, documenting is to document what you actually did to resolve the issue in case something happens again, especially if the problem comes back quickly. Lessons learned is something you do after the fact, saying there was a break in procedure that caused the outage.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
He already verified so the next step is to document
A. Verify the services are restored.

questions.question_text:
A company’s cloud model consists of the following:

• An on-premises data center
• An IaaS cloud provider
• A private-direct connection from on premises to IaaS

Which of the following best describes the deployment model the company is using?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
On premesis data center + private cloud = hybrid

questions.question_text:
A network technician is troubleshooting a port channel issue. When logging in to one of the switches, the technician sees the following information displayed:

Native VLAN mismatch detected on interface g0/1

Which of the following layers of the OSI model is most likely to be where the issue resides?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Layer 2.
VLAN (Virtual Local Area Network) and port channel configurations occur at Layer 2 (Data Link layer) of the OSI model because they deal with the segmentation and aggregation of network traffic at the Ethernet frame level
Every question I’ve seen so far that has iperf as an answer choice, ends up being iperf as the actual answer. Please don’t take my word for it, do your own research, but I think it’s helpful to note.

Selected Answer: C
C. iperf
Iperf is a tool used for measuring the maximum TCP and UDP bandwidth performance. It generates traffic between two endpoints and measures the throughput of the connection.

questions.question_text: A network engineer installed a new fiber uplink for an office and wants to make sure that the link meets throughput requirements. Which of the following tools should the engineer use to verify that the new link is sufficient?
